@SoftWarez

How does one detect if an mp3 has been upconverted?
A classic cant stop listening to it.

You can tell a MP3 is upconverted by how "crisp" it is.  Many times "S"s and high frequencies will sound slurred.  NoFS's stuff is always high quality though.  You can upconvert music using converters or Virtual DJ or programs that will let you alter the song frequencies.  Virtual DJ lets you do this.  And record it.  Also you can tell if a MP3 is upconverted by the fact it is JOINT STEREO or only 44100 Hz.  Studio CDs are almost always only Stereo and 48000Hz.  Also you can tell if the LAME plugin is used.

Hope this helps.  I personally like NoFS's work though and I think his stuff always sounds great.

Thanks man,
